channel.title: Looking for new CPU...
channel.description:
So I currently have an AM2+ socket AMD64 x2 +3800 OC'ed @ 2.5ghz (factory 2.0). Does anyone have a recommendation for an upgrade? something very overclockable is nice, and looking at around $100-150 mark. The CPU is the last item on my upgrade chopping block... then it starts all over again :'( oh yeah, mobo can take up to Phenom II.
pleasantries don't seem to go very far in this forum, but thanks in advance :smiley:

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
Ciledog:

A Q8400 is good, you can overclock it to 3 GHz (stock 2.66). But first check if your motherboard supports it.


the post.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
get a AMD Phenom II 945 or 955 BE they’re cheap, you don’t have to buy a new mainboard and they can be overclocked very well

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Or if u want a quad core get a q6600, you can get it pretty cheap now and its a great overclocker. Mine is currently running at 3.5ghz stable on air cooling.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Ciledog:

A Q8400 is good, you can overclock it to 3 GHz (stock 2.66).

But first check if your motherboard supports it, had to get a new one because of that.

But now it’s running fine at 2.9 GHz (my room has shitty ventilation)

Damn that is a shitty overclock, I’ve bought three CPU’s and 2 of them had better overclock than this with the stock cooler.

Currently running a 2.2Ghz Core 2 Duo at 2.98 Ghz, my other CPU is a 1.8Ghz (conroe core) Pentium Dual Core that ran non-stop at 2.88Ghz since I bought it and still works perfectly.

Anyway if you’re gonna do the switch to intel I recommend the E8400 (quite fast 3.00Ghz stock, overclockable to around 3.9/4 if you’re lucky, but you’ll need fast ram and an aftermarket CPU cooler)

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Dude his mobo only supports AMD cpu’s.

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
First update the bios then get the Advanced Micro Devices Athlon II X4 630 Quad-Core, it’s 2.8Ghz, and it’s good for am2 and am3 motherboards. It’s 130$ Canadian.

Check it out at Wintronic computers.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for new CPU...
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
What board do you have? Does it support ALL Phenom II CPUs? As in full AM3 socket compatibility.
